channel.title: Pages on In Code We Trust
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on In Code We Trust

item.title: About me
item.description: Iâ€™m a data scientist and consultant although originally I studied pharmacy and biology, finishing my Pharm.D./Ph.D. with groups in France, Germany, and the United States.. Besides, being of an inquisitive nature, I usually get interested in miscellaneous subjects. I cultivate coding skills as well as a marked preference for Unix and R. During my Ph.D. I rapidly got submerged in data, so that I eventually had to code on a daily basis.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Every once in a while, I’ve an idea that is worth to create a package about. A list of such projects below. indexSort This package–currently hosted on GitHub–contains functions to retrieve index sorted data and visually explore .fcs date files from various cell sorters. It has been adapted as a plugin for FlowJo and is available via the FlowJo Exchange. clustRcheck This package–currently hosted on GitHub–contains statistical hypothesis testing for discovering the presence of more than one mode in cluster distributions.

item.title: Useful Resources
item.description: Other websites Bob Rudis’s blog, most beautiful visualizations Damiano Fantini’s blog, useful R and python code Hadley Wickham’s website, the R bible Julia Silge’s blog, a truly inspirational one Diverse books An introduction to statistical learning, a must have Practical Data Science with R, basic principles and real use cases R Graphics Cookbook, for ggplot2 heroes R in a Nutshell, quick reference for beginners
